meanings.definition: Managed in an excessive or overly controlling manner.
meanings.sent1: The team felt stifled by the overmanaged project guidelines.
meanings.sent2: The office became less efficient when it was overmanaged by the new supervisor.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was overmanaged to the point where no one could relax and enjoy the food.
meanings.sent4: Her overmanaged schedule was like a tightly wound spring, ready to snap at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The garden looked overmanaged, with every plant perfectly pruned and arranged.

meanings.definition: Past tense of manage in an excessive or overly controlling manner.
meanings.sent1: She overmanaged the situation, trying to control every detail.
meanings.sent2: The project suffered because she overmanaged it, not allowing any creative input.
meanings.sent3: He overmanaged the family vacation, planning every minute of every day.
meanings.sent4: The coach overmanaged the game, making all the decisions without consulting the team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher overmanaged the group project, assigning tasks without considering the students' strengths.
